de.humatic.dsj.com

Class ICodecAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.humatic.dsj.com.COMObject
      • de.humatic.dsj.com.ICodecAPI

  • public class ICodecAPI
extends COMObject
    Wrapper around the native ICodecAPI interface exposed by some newer Microsoft codec filters. This is highly abstracted API that uses key / value pairs for an extensive list of properties. Keys are GUIDs and values are given as VARIANTs. dsj's implementation passes GUIDs as Strings, all numeric VARIANT values as double and BSTR or GUID VARIANT values as Strings. Documentation for available properties can be found on MSDN. To find out about valid property GUIDs, defined values and the VARIANT types used with them see the codecAPI.h file available in the Windows SDK's include folder.
    To get an instance of this class, call COMFactory.queryInterface(...) with the codec filter and COMFactory.IID_ICodecAPI as arguments.
    This class is only supported on Windows XP Service Pack 2 and greater.

    • Method Detail

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported(java.lang.String keyGUID)

      • isModifiable

        public boolean isModifiable(java.lang.String keyGUID)

      • getParameterRange

        public double[] getParameterRange(java.lang.String forKey)
        Returns minimum, maximum and valid stepsize values for parameters with a linear range. Will throw an Exception with errorcode VFW_E_CODECAPI_ENUMERATED (0x80040331) when the parameter uses enumerated values. In that case use getParameterValues instead.

      • getParameterValues

        public java.lang.String[] getParameterValues(java.lang.String forKey)
        Returns valid values for parameters with predefined values. Will throw an Exception with errorcode VFW_E_CODECAPI_LINEAR_RANGE (0x80040310) when the parameter uses enumerated values. In that case use getParameterRange instead. This method may return values that are actually passed as numbers in String form!

      • getVariantType

        public int getVariantType(java.lang.String forKey)
        Returns the data type used with the native VARIANT argument. Needed for the set methods.
